titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington Sub-Committee on Entertainment minutes 1978.021
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-21 20:51:43 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington Sub-Committee on Entertainment minutes

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Committee on the Centennial Celebration. Sub-Committee on Entertainment

did.abstract: The meeting minutes of the Sub-Committee on Entertainment of the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington are housed in a single volume and cover the period 1888 to 1889.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder. The materials were seemingly originally part of a single volume, but at the time of reprocessing the archivist found several loose sheets along with the volume, as well as folded pages that were deteriorating along their creases. The pages are in order of the original volume as much as possible.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The year 1889 marked the centennial of the inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States. On February 3, 1889, the Committee on the Centennial Celebration appointed a sub-committee entitled the Committee on Entertainment with Stuyvesant Fish as Chairman. The event took place on April 29 and 30, 1889 at the Metropolitan Opera House.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Many of the pages in this collection are damaged or broken along their creases and should be handled with extra care.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington Sub-Committee on Entertainment minutes, 1978.021, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The meeting minutes of the Sub-Committee on Entertainment of the Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States are housed in a single volume and cover the period 1888 to 1889.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
